Introducing Solaris

Solaris is a platform for distributing a quantifiable amount of influence in a code base or project. These are referred to as credits. By assigning credits based on the quality and quantity of contributions, project maintainers can foster a collaborative environment where contributors feel valued and motivated to engage actively.

Ownership

We are enabling maintainers to strategically distribute influence, ensuring that key stakeholders have the appropriate level of input in decision-making processes.

Project Sustainability

Ultimately, customizable credit allocation promotes transparency, accountability, and efficiency in project management, driving the success and sustainability of open source initiatives.

Try Solaris
Integrates with GitHub, Gitlab, and more to come.

Tame PR Chaos, Amplify Project Quality

Not all pull requests are created equal. Solaris empowers your team to navigate the sea of PRs with finesse, efficiently managing varying degrees of relevance and quality. Say goodbye to PR chaos and hello to elevated project quality with our precision PR management features.

Secure your open source dependencies

Solaris provides the tools you need to actively participate in the sustainability and evolution of vital open source initiatives. Enable interested parties to contribute to the long-term sustainability of open source software with our tailored influence management solutions.

Incentivize valuable contributions

Influence matters. Whether you're managing a small team or a large community, tailor contributor credits to reflect their level of involvement and expertise. With this granular control, you can ensure that key stakeholders have the influence they need while maintaining balance and fairness across your projects.

Frequently Asked Questions:

This is as simple as logging in to Solaris and choosing which of your repositories on GitHub or Gitlab you would like to connect. You can configure the credit distribution at anytime and even pause its connection to the repository. There are no additional downloads or installations required.

Absolutely. Solaris puts the power in the hands of project maintainers, allowing them to tailor the credit allocation to match the contributions and expertise of individual contributors. This means that maintainers can adjust credit amounts dynamically, ensuring that recognition and influence accurately reflect each contributor's impact on the project.

Contributors can use their credits for various actions such as voting on proposed changes, merging or closing pull requests, assigning roles, and participating in decision-making processes within the project.

Yes, contributors have the opportunity to earn additional credits for their ongoing contributions to the project over time.

Yes, our platform provides tracking and analytical tools that allow you to monitor the influence and contributions of individual users over time. This enables project maintainers to recognize and reward consistent contributors, fostering a sense of appreciation and motivation within the community. Additionally, tracking individual contributions helps identify emerging leaders and experts within the project, allowing maintainers to delegate responsibilities and roles effectively. Ultimately, the ability to track and analyze individual user influence and contributions facilitates a more transparent, equitable, and sustainable project ecosystem.
